document.heading: Public Information and Legislative Publishing Act of 2017
document.text: At a duly called Session of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 12th day of August 2017, the following Resolution and Law were adopted.

recital.text: the Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article VI, Section 6(a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe; and,

the 7 District Legislators serve as the Peoples' representatives to ensure that the Tribe's government acts in a transparent and responsible manner in accordance with the Constitution and laws of the Tribe; and,
the Constitution requires the Legislature to publish certain documents including proposed laws, Legislative Orders, votes of the Legislature, and to otherwise provide information to the public.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE IT BE IT RESOLVED;
recital.text: that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "PUBLIC INFORMATION AND LEGISLATIVE PUBLISHING ACT OF 2017".

text.b: C E R T I F I C A T I O N

procedural-data.text: The foregoing Resolution KL-CY-2017-017 was duly voted upon at a duly called Session IV of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 12th day of August 2017, the following Resolution and Law were adopted, with a vote of ( 7 ) in favor, and ( 0 ) opposed, ( 0 ) abstaining, and ( 0 ) absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Kiowa Tribe Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.

text.b: C E R T I F I C A T I O N

procedural-data.text: The foregoing Resolution KL-CY-2017-017 was duly voted upon at a duly called Session IV of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 12th day of August 2017, the following Resolution and Law were adopted, with a vote of ( 7 ) in favor, and ( 0 ) opposed, ( 0 ) abstaining, and ( 0 ) absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Kiowa Tribe Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as, the "PUBLIC INFORMATION AND LEGISLATIVE PUBLISHING ACT OF 2017" ("Act").

para.text: The 7 District Legislators serve as the Peoples' representatives to ensure that the Tribe's government acts in a transparent and responsible manner in accordance with the Constitution and laws of the Tribe.
The Constitution requires the Legislature to publish certain documents including proposed laws, Legislative Orders, votes of the Legislature, and to otherwise provide information to the public;

Members of the Tribe live in all areas of the Tribe's Territory and outside the Tribe's Territory, and the use of modern forms of electronic communication to publish and receive information from the Tribe, including from the Legislature, is the most cost-effective method to comply with the publishing requirements of the Constitution.

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to authorize and direct the Information Technology Program and Personnel ("IT Personnel") to publish on the Tribe's official website documents and information provided by the Legislature including proposed laws (bills), Legislative Orders, records and tallies of the votes of the Legislature, proceeding of the Legislature including official Sessions and hearings, enacted laws, and other important information.

section.heading: Publication of Documents and Information from the Legislature.
section.text: In order to guarantee that the Members of the Tribe have timely access to the official publications of the Tribe including documents and other important information from the Legislature, the Legislature hereby authorizes and directs the IT Personnel to publish on the Tribe's official website all documents and information provided by the Legislature and that includes a specific request to publish ("Request To Publish") such documents and/or information. The Request To Publish may include proposed laws (bills), Legislative Orders, records and tallies of the votes of the Legislature, proceeding of the Legislature including official Sessions and hearings, enacted laws, and other important information.

Upon receipt of a Request To Publish, the IT Personnel shall publish the documents and information in a timely manner without modification or alternation, and the documents and information shall remain published until the Legislature provides a specific, written request to discontinue such publication.

section.heading: Development of Website for the Legislative
section.text: The IT Personnel shall assist the Legislature with the development of a website for the purpose of communications with the public.
